meanings.definition: To fasten or tighten with a screw.
meanings.sent1: Dad screwed the shelf onto the wall.
meanings.sent2: She screwed the lid tightly onto the jar.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter screwed the pieces together with precision.
meanings.sent4: He screwed the loose doorknob back into place.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic screwed the bolts in securely to fix the engine.

meanings.sent1: The con artist screwed the old lady out of her savings.
meanings.sent2: He screwed his friend by selling him a broken phone.
meanings.sent3: The scammer screwed people by promising fake prizes.
meanings.sent4: She felt screwed after realizing she had been tricked.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest salesman screwed customers with false claims.

meanings.definition: In a difficult or hopeless situation.
meanings.sent1: After missing the last bus, she was really screwed for getting home.
meanings.sent2: He knew he was screwed when he saw the approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: Being stuck in traffic, they were royally screwed for making it to the movie on time.
meanings.sent4: The team was screwed without their star player in the final match.
meanings.sent5: Without a map, they were completely screwed in finding their way out of the maze.
